txt.en: Collected bladder of grog. It smells terrible
You found a dying Uruk surrounded by the corpses of dozens of his fellows, and he promised to tell you what happened if you bring him life-sustaining grog.

'Ugh... if you come any closer... I will gut you, [placeholder]. See... if I don't....'

The Uruk sputters, coughing up blood, and grits his teeth together. He tries to reach the blade lying nearby, but it is just out of his reach.

'You must be... a friend of his? The one who did this?'

The Uruk laughs, a guttural sound, and coughs up more black blood.

'I'll make you... ugh... a deal... [placeholder]. Find one of my kind... and take a bladder of grog from him. Bring it to me... and I will tell you... what happened here. Do it, maggot! Or leave me to die... and you will never know... what happened....'

The Uruk scowls.

'And I will know if it's been... lying around next to a corpse... so bring me a fresh one!'

Uruks throughout the East Wall carry bladders of grog on their person with which they can fortify themselves.\n\nThe dying Uruk you found wants a bladder of grog in exchange for telling you what happened at the Dead Orc Glade.

'Ugh... if you come any closer... I will gut you, [placeholder]. See... if I don't....'

The Uruk sputters, coughing up blood, and grits his teeth together. He tries to reach the blade lying nearby, but it is just out of his reach. You steel your resolve, fighting the instincts of your dwarf-forebears. You would slay this Uruk where he lies... but what does he know?

'You must be... a friend of his? The one who did this?'

The Uruk laughs, a guttural sound, and coughs up more black blood.

'I'll make you... ugh... a deal... [placeholder]. Find one of my kind... and take a bladder of grog from him. Bring it to me... and I will tell you... what happened here. Do it, maggot! Or leave me to die... and you will never know... what happened...'

The Uruk scowls.

'And I will know if it's been... lying around next to a corpse... so bring me a fresh one!'
The dying Uruk is in the Dead Orc Glade, in the East Wall.\n\nYou have found a bladder of grog and should bring it back to the dying Uruk.

'Bring me a... bladder of grog... or I will tell you nothing! Ugh... agh....'

The dying Uruk sputters up more blood.

'I don't care how many... of my fellows you have to kill... to get it....'

'Ugh... if you come any closer... I will gut you, [placeholder]. See... if I don't....'

The Uruk sputters, coughing up blood, and grits his teeth together. He tries to reach the blade lying nearby, but it is just out of his reach. You steel your resolve, fighting the instincts of your fellow Elves and those who came before. You would slay this Uruk where he lies... but what does he know?

'You must be... a friend of his? The one who did this?'

The Uruk laughs, a guttural sound, and coughs up more black blood.

'I'll make you... ugh... a deal... [placeholder]. Find one of my kind... and take a bladder of grog from him. Bring it to me... and I will tell you... what happened here. Do it, maggot! Or leave me to die... and you will never know... what happened....'

The Uruk scowls.

'And I will know if it's been... lying around next to a corpse... so bring me a fresh one!'

'Ugh... if you come any closer... I will gut you, halfling. See... if I don't....'

The Uruk sputters, coughing up blood, and grits his teeth together. He tries to reach the blade lying nearby, but it is just out of his reach.

'You must be... a friend of his? The one who did this?'

The Uruk laughs, a guttural sound, and coughs up more black blood.

'I'll make you... ugh... a deal... halfling. Find one of my kind... and take a bladder of grog from him. Bring it to me... and I will tell you... what happened here. Do it, maggot! Or leave me to die... and you will never know... what happened....'

The Uruk scowls.

'And I will know if it's been... lying around next to a corpse... so bring me a fresh one!'

'Give it... give it here....'

The dying Uruk takes a gulp from the grog, and it seems to reinvigorate him.

'Ah... that did the trick... that's the stuff. You want to hear what happened here?'
Collect a bladder of grog from an Uruk in the East Wall
Bring the bladder of grog to the dying Uruk
